summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the saints and faithful brothers in Christ in Colossae. Grace to you and peace from God our Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks always to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ when we pray for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since we heard about your faith in Christ Jesus and the love that you have for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the hope reserved for you in heaven, which you have heard about beforehand in the word of truth, the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that has come to you, just as also in all the world it is bearing fruit and increasing, just as also among you from the day you heard about and understood the grace of God in truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you learned it from Epaphras, our dear fellow slave who is a faithful minister of Christ on our behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also made clear to us your love in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this also we, from the day we heard about it, did not cease praying for you, and asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual insight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may live in a manner worthy of the Lord, to please him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good deed and increasing in the knowledge of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: enabled with all power, according to his glorious might, for all steadfastness and patience with joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks to the Father who has qualified you for a share of the inheritance of the saints in light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has rescued us from the domain of darkness and transferred us to the kingdom of the Son he loves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have the redemption, the forgiveness of sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because all things in the heavens and on the earth were created by him, things visible and things invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or powers, all things were created through him and for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he himself is before all things, and in him all things are held together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he himself is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, so that he himself may become first in everything,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was well pleased for all the fullness to dwell in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and through him to reconcile all things to himself, by making peace through the blood of his cross, through him, whether things on earth or things in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although you were formerly alienated and enemies in attitude, because of your evil deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but now you have been reconciled by his physical body through death, to present you holy and blameless and above reproach before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed you remain in the faith, established and steadfast and not shifted away from the hope of the gospel that you heard, which was proclaimed in all creation under heaven, of which I, Paul, became a minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I rejoice in my sufferings on behalf of you, and I fill up in my flesh what is lacking of the afflictions of Christ, on behalf of his body which is the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of which I became a minister, according to God’s stewardship which was given to me for you, to complete the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the mystery which has been hidden from the ages and from the generations, but has now been revealed to his saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom God wanted to make known what is the glorious wealth of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom we proclaim, by admonishing every person and teaching every person with all wisdom, in order that we may present every person mature in Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which purpose also I labor, striving according to his working which is at work powerfully in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I want you to know how great a struggle I have on behalf of you, and those in Laodicea, and all those who have not seen my face in person,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that their hearts may be encouraged, united in love and into all the wealth of the full assurance of insight into the knowledge of the mystery of God, Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this in order that no one will deceive you with persuasive speech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for even if I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing and seeing your good order and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore as you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, live in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: firmly rooted and built up in him and established in the faith, just as you were taught, abounding with thankfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest anyone take you captive through philosophy and empty deceit, according to human tradition, according to the elemental spirits of the world and not according to Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because in him all the fullness of deity dwells bodily,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are filled in him, who is the head over every ruler and authority,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom also you were circumcised with a circumcision not made by hands, by the removal of the body of the flesh, by the circumcision of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been buried with him in baptism, in which also you were raised together with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although you were dead in the trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, he made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having destroyed the certificate of indebtedness in ordinances against us, which was hostile to us, and removed it out of the way by nailing it to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had disarmed the rulers and the authorities, he made a display of them in public, triumphing over them by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not let anyone judge you with reference to eating or drinking or participation in a feast or a new moon or a Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which are a shadow of what is to come, but the reality is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one condemn you, taking pleasure in humility and the worship of angels, going into detail about the things which he has seen, inflated without cause by his fleshly mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not holding fast to the head, from whom the whole body, supported and held together by the ligaments and sinews, grows with the growth of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have died with Christ to the elemental spirits of the world, why do you submit to them as if living in the world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not handle, do not taste, do not touch,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which things are all meant for destruction by consuming according to human commandments and teachings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which things although they have, to be sure, an appearance of wisdom in self-made religion and humility and unsparing treatment of the body, do not have any value against the indulgence of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if you have been raised together with Christ, seek the things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your mind on the things above, not on the things on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ, who is your life, is revealed, then you also will be revealed with him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore put to death what is earthly in you: sexual immorality, uncleanness, lustful passion, evil desire, and greediness, which is idolatry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of which the wrath of God is coming upon the sons of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which also you once lived, when you used to live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you also lay aside all these things: anger, rage, wickedness, slander, abusive language from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie to one another, because you have taken off the old man together with his deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have put on the new man that is being renewed in knowledge according to the image of the one who created him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, slave, or free, but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as the chosen of God, holy and dearly loved, put on affection, compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, patience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: putting up with one another and forgiving one another. If anyone should have a complaint against anyone, just as also the Lord forgave you, thus also you do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to all these things add love, which is the bond of perfection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the peace of Christ must rule in your hearts, to which also you were called in one body, and be thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly, teaching and admonishing one another with all wisdom, with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with thankfulness in your hearts to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and everything whatever you do in word or in deed, giving thanks for all things in the name of the Lord Jesus to God the Father through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives and do not be embittered against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is pleasing in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not provoke your children, so that they will not become discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, obey your human masters in everything, not while being watched, as people pleasers, but with sincerity of heart, fearing the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you do, accomplish it from the soul, as to the Lord, and not to people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you know that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance. Serve the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who does wrong will receive back whatever wrong he has done, and there is no partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, grant your slaves justice and fairness, knowing that you also have a master in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be devoted to prayer, keeping alert in it with thanksgiving,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praying at the same time for us also, that God may open for us a door of the message, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which also I am a prisoner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that I may reveal it, as it is necessary for me to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Live with wisdom toward those outside, making the most of the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how it is necessary for you to answer each one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tychicus, my dear brother and faithful servant and fellow slave in the Lord, will make known to you all my circumstances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I have sent to you for this very reason, in order that you may know our circumstances and he may encourage your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: together with Onesimus, my faithful and dear brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all the circumstances here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, greets you, and Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (about whom you received instructions—if he should come to you, welcome him),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus who is called Justus. These are the only ones who are fellow workers for the kingdom of God from the circumcision, who have been a comfort to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, who is one of you, greets you, a slave of Christ always struggling on behalf of you in his prayers, that you may stand mature and fully assured in all the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I testify to him that he is working hard on behalf of you and those in Laodicea and those in Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke the physician, our dear friend, greets you, as does Demas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet the brothers in Laodicea, and Nympha and the church in her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever this letter is read among you, see to it that it is read also among the Laodicean church, and that you also read the letter from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And tell Archippus, “Direct your attention to the ministry that you received in the Lord, in order that you may complete it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The greeting is by my hand, Paul’s. Remember my imprisonment. Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
